markings: Stamp in black ink, on verso: D.F.P. [in circle] [Lugt 750a]

titles.title: Female Peasant Carrying Two Buckets in a Farmyard or Garden

makers.displaydate: 1830–1903; born Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, died Paris, France
makers.displaymaker: Camille Pissarro, 1830–1903; born Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, died Paris, France

texts.textentryhtml:
Pissarro was a prolific printmaker and avid draftsman, sketching incessantly to quickly capture, in a few simple lines, the characteristic gestures and dress of people working in the fields and marketplaces of Normandy. The artist used these drawings, collected in small sketchbooks and pads, as studio reference material for his paintings and prints, in which figures in favored poses sometimes reappear multiple times in various compositions over many years. All three of these drawings are pages from sketchbooks that were dismantled
by dealers for individual sale after the artist’s death.
1938, Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt to Princeton University Art Museum

bibliography.boilertext: Christopher Lloyd, "Camille Pissarro at Princeton," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 41, no. 1 (1982): p. 2–13.
